column4: first the file need to be marked as "executable", you can do that in nautilus or in a terminal (chmod a+x) then you just type ./filename.bin in a terminal and it should run.. or double click it
I'm done what you said, it is still not installing however
no error messages, no results at all?
no I don't get an error messeage....
well.. then there's not a lot I can do
I've even right clicked on the .bin and selected properties and changed the permission to allow ececuting file as program..still it will not install
when I double click to install I get " Cound not display "/home/russ/Desktop/adobe.bin".
oh.. so you *do* get an error message
can you pastebin the output from ls -l where this file is located?
you can add the part where you try to run it from the terminal too
and what happens if you type "./adobe.bin" in that same terminal?
:) wow that worked, what was I dong wrong?
thank you. have a nice day
